Text:
Tokenscript Support
- Overhaul to support Tokenscript.
- Bump to version 2.00.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Remove Streams
Remove Streams from source as incompatible with older versions of Android.

This crash was reported from crashlytics - the form of the crash was that 'stream()' method is not available, which would only occur on an old version of Android.

This PR removes all usage of the 'stream()' method and replaces with more conventional loops.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Tokenscript fixes from hackathon
The following tokenscript issues were discovered during hackathon:

- no tokenId in props, add it in and ensure standardisation when any prop type is added.
- crash if no functions are present but function is specified (caused by user error in Tokenscript file).

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
QR scanning from inside the app
During hackathon it was found that it was difficult to scan QR import codes from within the wallet.

Thus, I added ability to scan magiclink QR codes from any camera activity in the app.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
ERC721 Tokenscript
Upgrade tokenscript handling to be ERC721 compatible.

This was done to make tokenscript handling for all tokens more generic - previously ERC721 wasn't supported. The upgrade allowed the Cryptokitties Tokenscript to be demoed at the Ethereum conference; 

Once we have the kitties Tokenscript working on iOS then we can release it to the server. The script may require a little formatting to make it look a bit better.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix auto download
Fix for auto download file location (for Chinese users mainly), plus fix the resource leak observed from time to time if the server can't find the location.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Implement EIP681 token sends
According to crashlytics logging some users have been trying to use EIP681 with ERC20 token requests. In order to fully implement this there are some precautions we need to take:

When we receive a transfer request for token, if the token is not cached then we need to retrieve it first, and fill the balance in.

Is it a known transfer request? If not then simply display the function to the user for approval.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fixes from hackathon
Minor update to fix UI issues spotted during the hackathon.

This is an adhoc PR which fixes many small issues eg:

- fix incorrect return type.
- ensure function definitions are reset for each use.
- handle tokenscript function attributes (ie attributes which call an Ethereum contract function) with multiple tokenIds eg in cryptokitty script 'isViableBreedingPair(tokenId[0], tokenId[[1])'.
- small cody tidyups.

NB this PR builds on the 'ERC721 TokenScript' PR so needs to be merged after that one.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix swipe event issue
As reported by @zhangzhongnan928 on the Telegram group. 

It was impossible to scroll down on a website that was slightly longer than the screen height as this gesture was intercepted as a screen refresh event.

This PR makes the swipe refresh event detection less sensitive; specifically to trigger it you need to swipe downward more than 400 pixels within 300ms. These figures were arrived at by collecting swipe gesture pattern data; typically a swipe refresh fling gesture lasts only 100ms and will be well over 500 pixels. Using the more generous data still allows easy refresh but lets through browser scrolling.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix standard eth transaction
Addressing #745, standard ETH dapp transactions have never been supported.

Logic was changed to ensure all types of Dapp transaction are handled correctly, and also added a 'check contract' button in the confirmation screen so the user can check the contract they're calling on etherscan.

Text:
Catch and display Dapp data errors
Added diagnostic error display for Dapp developers. If signing message is malformed the resulting exception will be caught and displayed as an error message.

Fix importing metamask EIP681 address QR code.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Add required types for tokenscript
Fix for tokenscript native send function (determine correct send address) and add tokens which are defined in debug tokenscript to tokens list.

Fixes #814

Text:
Fix using correct name in injected tokenscript properties
Fixes #812 , check if tokenscript defines a token name and use that in the injected token properties.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix to initial wallet creation
Fixes a reported issue where sometimes no Ethereum main net balance card appears when first creating a wallet, until another refresh is done.

Was caused by a race condition as the main page would be started twice - a background thread fetching the balance would be interrupted by the second instance of the main page, leading to the tokens service getting refreshed part way through clashing with the return from the second instance of the balance update.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix issue where sometimes the webview doesn't display
This PR fixes an issue where Android had deprecated or changed the internal code to load data directly into the webview. The issue manifests by sometimes seeing 'no data' in the function webview, especially in newer phones using Android 9. It is most likely due to certain data sequences not rendering correctly and triggering an exception.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix tokenscript contract handling
Fixes Tokenscript defined smart contract function call with user-input base currency value.

Visible as:
- tokenscript call incorrectly sending raw currency when there was a function call.
- Incorrect description of transaction in confirmation page.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Ensure complete wallet object is passed
Issue discovered during testing. Using the 'long press' method on the token view, send/transfer on the bottom bar appear. When you click on these we need to pass the whole wallet object to the next activity so that any signing works.

Note: depending on which wallet type you have, signing works differently - HD Key, Keystore, Keystore legacy, Watch. This is why the whole wallet object was passed. This bug was in since the HD Key overhaul, but only affects ERC875, and only when you use the long press to pop up the send/transfer buttons.

Author: JamesSmartCell
Text:
Fix token titles
- Strip garbage characters from token name if name specified in bytes type rather than string type.
- If token has a very long balance (eg 19999944475) then split the name onto the next line to avoid display appearing cluttered.

(Both points noticed when handling a token with some bad characters in the name and a very large balance, FYI: Rinkeby 0x8D8Df3Ec3ca5D0b23F465754830B866238c43B7e).

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Additional features
• Use only high variance genes for speed up at the cost of some performance.
• Can specify values for additional parameters used by Phenograph.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
v1.1 High Variance Genes
• Use only high variance genes for speed up at the cost of some performance.
• Can specify values for additional parameters used by Phenograph.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
V1.2 Hypergeometric p-Values
• Better performance calling doublets by computing a p-value from hypergeometric testing on the level of synthetic doublet enrichment in each cluster.
• Multiple runs can be specified to produce significantly better p-values. Our recommendation, and the default setting, is 5 runs.

Closes #18.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Exclude unclustered cells from deciding doublets.
Unclustered cells receive 'np.NaN' for their score and p-value.

Resolves #48.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Voting scheme
Updates classification methodology: cells with p-value > 0.99 on at least 90% of iterations are called doublets. Both thresholds are parameters to `.fit` (these are the default values).

Updates `n_iters`, `n_top_var_genes`, and `phenograph_parameters` defaults to be in line with updated methodology.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Installable Packaging
Provides typical python package installation.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
v2.0 API Stablized
Finalizes all public facing parameters, methods, and attributes.
Includes removing many. Be sure to check the fully updated docstrings.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Conforms to #68 when n_iters == 1
Ensures .labels_ is np.nan for cells that fail to join a cluster.

Propose to close #68 with this, as the warning it references is long gone anyway.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Fast(er) Normalize
Optimizes the default normalization method by memoizing the normalized `raw_counts`.

Also improves the install process robustness, and ensures consistent labeling of cells that join no cluster when `n_iters == 1`.

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Log p-values
- p-values now the result of hypergeometric test for over-representation, not under-representation
- internally calculate and work with log p-values
- add all_log_p_values_ attribute
- threshold plot to evaluate solutions at different threshold levels
- updated notebook

Author: JonathanShor
Text:
Verbosity
Adds `verbose` parameter so user can tell doubletdetection to be silent.

Only open question is do we want some improved granularity on message presentation? Fairly straight forward to do with `logging`, but is it worthwhile, @adamgayoso?

Closes #64 either way.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Add support to control network on which the container will run on
When the container runs inside network namespace some of the files under /proc/sys/net/ are not available inside the container. We need to have option to run the container with --net=host parameter to get this files inside the container. 
docker_container module of ansible gives this option via the network_mode parameter.
This patch makes this configurable here as well.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Replace `import_tasks` with `include_tasks` for the main task
When using `import_tasks` with conditionals ansible will
apply conditional to all imported tasks.
In our case this will results to a very big log of skipped
tasks.
It is cleaner to use `include_tasks` instead.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Fix: UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte X.
Our tests started failing on
```
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe2 in position 35: ordinal not in range(128)".
```
With this PR the issue is solved, since aparently we are printing in the logs some non ascii characters. Should we support utf-8 here or should I make sure that I print only ascii characters in the logs?
In case the PR is ok, I 'll repost adjusting the changelog file.

Thanks for your feedback!

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Fix case of incorrect status when test was skipped in setup.
When some test was skipped in the setup, RP wrongly identified its
status, by assigning to it the status of the last non-skipped test.

Test to reproduce:

```
import pytest

@pytest.fixture
def skip_in_setup():
    pytest.skip()

def test_that_fails():
    assert False

@pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_in_setup")
def test_skip_in_setup(self):
    pass
```

In this example the first test fails and the second is skipped.
RP identified both as failures.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: Hide 'Add Disk' component for oVirt provider
Since oVirt is not using libvirt's storage pools the list of pools
which is currently fetched from virsh pool-list command is of no
use in the oVirt plugin.
Having this in mind the storagePools property was not passed to the
HostVmsList React component reused from machines code, leading to
undefined property value.

This patch hides the Add Disk option until the pools discovery is
implemented inside oVirt plugin.

Fixes #9845

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: cleanup UPDATE_STORAGE_POOLS and UPDATE_STORAGE_VOLUMES reducers
UPDATE_STORAGE_POOLS reducer was overwriting storage volumes of each pool with
empty array each time it was called.
Then it expected that the UPDATE_STORAGE_VOLUMES re-filled the arrays.
This approach is not correct, since it causes component rerendering without actual
changes in the state and also in some cases we might even read wrong data,
if we try to read the state, after UPDATE_STORAGE_POOLS ran but not
UPDATE_STORAGE_VOLUMEs.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: testVCPU: fix race condition when reading state for UI update
There is a time frame between the UI component rerendering and the actual
update of the state.
In tests we solve this issue by using wait_present/wait_in_text function.
In the case we are opening modal dialog though, these are of no use,
since modal dialog values will not be updated while the modal is open.

This patch fixes such scenario for testVCPU.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Revert "machines: Disallow http URLs in favour of https"
This reverts commit 23b8ff366ee97dcea6a2c9e8946a81a0f571adaf.

After further discussion on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1644267
it was decided that this restriction was not necessary.

On the BZ it was suggested to also handle the virt-install error in case http driver is not supported and provide some more user friendly error.

TBH I don't feel very happy to change the errors of the tools we use. This might cover issues and the user will not be able to search with the actual error messages.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: remove useless notifications from disk tab
First commit removes the notifacation about starting VM to see disks statistics. Disk stats are available for disks of offline VMs, not sure since which libvirt version or if that's is somehow connected. I can't seem to be able to make domstats API not return disk statistics any more. I would leave it there, but it's blinking before the stats are fetched, and I prefered to remove it than to have it there for some corner cases I don't seem able to find.

Second commit removes the warning about old libvirt, since all version with libvirt version old enough to not support these APIs are not supported any more. Same here, it fixes the blinking notification issue.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Move commit modal handler code into the CommitModalComponent and enhance error messages
Container.jsx file is home to much code that should be split into different files. This makes this file a total mess.

By moving all the code related to ContainerCommit to the ContainerCommitModal we can get rid of all these useless handlers that we need to pass around the react components otherwise.

Also error messages previously were printed like JSON.stringify(ex) which is definitely not a user friendly way to tell 'you container commit failed'. So I changed a bit the presentation of error messages as well.

Text:
Refactor CreateImage && CreateBlueprint modal dialogs
This commit introduces the following changes:

gives us the available OS list is not aware of the variants.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Fix testNetworkingPage flake
testNetworkingPage was sometimes failing because of journal messages containing
the following line:

The name org.fedoraproject.FirewallD1 was not provided by any .service files

This is suprisingly an error coming from libvirtd, which is complaining
that firewalld was stopped while libvirtd was running. For more info
see, https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1348434

Since this is harmless for us, and as mentioned in the BZ is an WONTFIX
issue, let's ignore it in the test's teardown checks.

This test was failing from time to time because virsh was returning 'no' for
the active property even though we already received a signal that the
Network got active from the DBus API.

I haven't figured out why virsh might return wrong data the first time,
and I can't reproduce locally either. So, let's give it some time to react to
the event by waiting for the answer to be correct.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
Robustify testNetworkSettings by waiting for the networks to get inactive before undefining
There is currently a race condition making this test fail often. It
looks like that destroying and undefining the network right after emits
almost concurrent events, and the UI state is not updated correctly.

Although this deserves an actual fix let's robustify this tests by
waiting for the networks to get deactivated before detaching.

Some cleanup in the singal handlers will come as a followup.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: drop bsd, pc98 and sun format types for disk type pools
Libvirt support for these types is genuinely broken and marked as not fix.
See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=980349

They are indeed not common so I just drop the from the UI, I don't think
it worths to ask support for these from libvirt.

Author: KKoukiou

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
tools, bots: Stop bringing libvirt package as a dependency of cockpit-machines
The test images should also not contain libvirt, libvirt-daemon-kvm is
sufficient.

In fact users that don't have libvirt-daemon-kvm installed but only
libvirt package will face issues with installing VMs from ISO URLs,
because qemu-block-curl is not dependency of the libvirt package and
that package provides this functionality.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: fix inspecting VM Disks tab when the disk resides on an inactive pool
There are places in cockpit-machines codebase which asume that
storagePool.volumes is always an array.
Such example was the code showing the VM Disks tab.
Inactive pools don't have volume information however, which resulted in
the relevant code to crash when the involved pool was inactive.

Make sure to have an empty array as value to 'volumes' key to avoid such
issues.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
machines: when fetching storage pools refresh them first if they are active
This commit calls the poolRefresh API everytime when fetching the list storage
pools. This will trigger the refresh event to get emited, which will
call the GET_STORAGE_POOL for each refreshed pool.
Inactive pools don't have events, so call directly the GET_STORAGE_POOL
method for those.

This commit will allow the user to refresh pool data by reloading the browser page.

Relevant to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1680293

Text:
Fix issue with jumping action buttons in WebKit browsers
Replace `<caption>` element from cockpit lists because of the following
reasons:

- it skips the a11y tree for headings
- we overload it with stuff that it isn't intended for

Related to https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=187903.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:

should insert the Operating System information, because without that,
they will end up with guest that severely underperforms.

Text:
machines: When receiving *EVENT_DEFINED add a minimal representation of the resource to the state

in the pool whose creation failed to appear in the UI anyway.

Author: KKoukiou
Text:
backport: machines: add missing updateOnly parameter in getStoragePool action
This missing parameter was causing TestMachines.testStoragePools to fail
sometimes since deleting a pool sometimes didn't remove the entry from the UI.
This reflects a real race condition when deleting an active resource, since
'Stopped' and 'Undefined' events get emited close to each other, which
makes state updates a bit cumbersome.
    
Relevant to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1715388
Cherry-picked from maste commit afae77.
    
Closes #12848

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
Fix incorrect settings causing failing heroku builds
#### What does this PR do?
- rename wsgi.py reference to authors.wsgi from authors.wsgi.py in heroku `Procfile`
- add the `STATIC_ROOT` path to settings
- add herokuapp to allowed hosts
#### Description of Task to be completed?
- The Procfile incorrectly referenced the `wsgi.py` as a file. It should be referenced as a module.
- The `collectstatic` command requires a destination for collected static files
- The base settings did not contain `herokuapp` as an allowed host, hence failing builds
#### How should this be manually tested?
- Visit this PR's [app](https://ah-backend-summer-stagin-pr-11.herokuapp.com/).

Text:
OCLOMRS-585: When creating mappings, internal and external mappings should be differentiated based on the source_type
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When creating mappings, internal and external mappings should be differentiated based on the source_type](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-585)

# Summary:
Currently, the functionality for updating mappings checks whether or not a concept is a CIEL concept in order to decide if it is an internal or external concept. This is not correct.

For MVP, we will consider concepts with a source_type of "externalDictionary" to be external. Concepts are internal otherwise.

OCLOMRS-591: When adding a concept to a collection, its mappings should be added as well
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When adding a concept to a collection, it's mappings should be added as well](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-591)

# Summary:
The endpoint for adding concept references to a collection includes a cascade query option.

We want to add these mappings to the collection, so it should be set to cascade=sourcemappings

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-590: If there is an error while updating a concept after the concept itself has been updated, its reference should still be updated
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[If there is an error while updating a concept after the concept itself has been updated, its reference should still be updated](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-590)

# Summary:
If a concept's details have been successfully updated, it's reference in the collection should also be updated.

Currently, if there is an error after a concept's details have been updated, but before the update method completes, the concept's reference is not updated, leading to us having an old reference to the concept in our collection

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-589: There should be a separate field for performing a search for internal mappings when creating or updating them
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[There should be a separate field for performing a search for internal mappings when creating or updating them](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-589)

# Summary:
Currently, the same fields used to enter the mapping details are used for search. This is not right, and the search box should be an independent field.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-594: Pressing enter in input field in the edit concept form triggers submit
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Pressing enter in input field in the edit concept form triggers submit](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-594)

# Summary:
The edit concept form is prematurely submitted when enter is pressed when the cursor is in an input

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-596: When a mapping is created or updated, a reference to it should be added to the collection
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When a mapping is created or updated, a reference to it should be added to the collection](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-596)

# Summary:
- When a mapping is created, we should also be adding a reference to it to the collection
- When a mapping is updated, we should also be updating its reference in the collection

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-588: When creating external mappings, a user should not be able to search for the to_concept
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When creating external mappings, a user should not be able to search for the to_concept](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-588)

# Summary:
to_concepts for external mappings do not exist in OCL and they should therefore not be searchable

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-600: Creating mappings to internal concepts should all have a single searchable field
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Creating mappings to internal concepts should all have a single searchable field](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-600)

# Summary:
- Creating mappings to internal concepts should all have only one single search field
- Currently, there are three fields, which can be confusing to the user

Text:
OCLOMRS-604: Raise Test Coverage
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Raise Test Coverage](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-604)

# Summary:
Address coverage drop on https://github.com/openmrs/openmrs-ocl-client/pull/481.

Text:
OCLOMRS-610: Fix Conflicting Tests
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Fix Conflicting Tests](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-610)

# Summary:
A few tests were not mocking some parts of the code/ not cleaning up after themselves, causing subsequent tests to fail

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-613: When a concept has no mapping references, we should not attempt to delete them
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When a concept has no mapping references, we should not attempt to delete them](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-613)

# Summary:
Attempting to request delete of an empty list of references returns a 400, causing the concept mappings not to be updated

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-612: Fix incorrect check for blank answer and set mappings
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Fix incorrect check for blank answer and set mappings](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-612)

# Summary:
The check for whether a mapping is blank is different from the one for whether an answer or set is blank. A new method is needed to reflect this.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-614: Fix incorrect filter for latest concept versions on dictionaryConcepts page
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Fix incorrect filter for latest concept versions on dictionaryConcepts page](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-614)

# Summary:
Previously, concepts created within OCL had a null external id. This is no longer the case. This updates the filter to reflect that.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-617: The locale_preffered field for names displays an incorrect value
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[The locale_preffered field for names displays an incorrect value](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-617)

# Summary:
The condition for displaying this field assumed that the field contains a 'Yes', 'No'. It contains a true/false. This needs to be updated.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-616: Names and Descriptions Should Have external_ids as well
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Names and Descriptions Should Have external_ids as well](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-616)

# Summary:
external_ids are required to perform imports in OpenMRS
Names and descriptions are currently creating these as null

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-615: Filtering and searching at the same time is not working on the dictionary concepts page

[Filtering and searching at the same time is not working on the dictionary concepts page](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-615)

# Summary:
Using one of these features turns off the other. Ideally a user should be able to search through filtered concepts

Text:

[Add clear all buttons for filter options](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-621)

# Summary:
I expected a “clear all” link for Datatypes and Classes (if I’ve checked 5-6 of them, don’t make me manually uncheck all of them to remove filters)

Text:
OCLOMRS-622: Remove confusing hover effect on action buttons

[Remove confusing hover effect on action buttons](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-622)

Button styling feels weird. If I hover over a button, it stops looking like a button (e.g., action buttons)

Text:
OCLOMRS-626: The class breakdown shows incorrect class counts

[The class breakdown shows incorrect class counts](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-626)

The “By class” breakdown isn’t working right. It shows “Diagnosis: 0” when I have a lot of diagnoses

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-640: When recursively importing concepts, a more informative spinner with what is actually going on is preferable
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When recursively importing concepts, a more informative spinner with what is actually going on is preferable](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-640)

# Summary:
The way the loader is displayed when the concepts are being added is confusing. It looks like the page is loading. The minimum should be an improved message when this is going on, but this should ideally be a notification telling the user exactly what is happening.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-628: Name types should be; Fully Specified, null: Synonym in UI, SHORT: Short in UI, Index Term
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Name types should be; Fully Specified, null: Synonym in UI, SHORT: Short in UI, Index Term](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-628)

# Summary:
 I try to create a concept with two names in English, the first one has type=Fully Specified, the second has type=Synonym. I get “An error occurred when creating a concept. Invalid name type” for the one that’s a synonym. (Possibly OpenMRS calls this “synonym” but OCL backend calls this nametype=null.)

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-638: Fallback to English as default locale when creating names and descriptions
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Fallback to English as default locale when creating names and descriptions](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-638)

# Summary:
In situations when we cannot find the locale we need from the default list, we should fall back to english

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-650: Populate sidenav not dispatched on the dictionary Concepts page
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Populate sidenav not dispatched on the dictionary Concepts page](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-650)

# Summary:
The condition for dispatching this action checks for an empty query string. This string is now a wildcard.

This updates the condition and default query to reflect this.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-649: The preffered language on a collection shows English even after it is changed to another language
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[The preffered language on a collection shows English even after it is changed to another language](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-649)

# Summary:
The preffered language on a collection shows English even after it is changed to another language.

This field uses an incorrect value, which does not exist. Updating this to the value in state.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-651: Searching for public dictionaries returns dictionaries with validation that is not OpenMRS
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Searching for public dictionaries returns dictionaries with validation that is not OpenMRS](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-651)

# Summary:
From [OCLOMRS-87](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-87), the public dictionaries page is expected to display only OpenMRS validated dictionaries

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-654: A user should be able to view and manage collections belonging to organisations they are part of- 1
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[A user should be able to view and manage collections belonging to organizations they are part of- 1](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-654)

# Summary:
- The view dictionaries page does not display dictionaries belonging to a user's organizations.
- The check for whether or not to display the edit button is coded to show up only when a logged in user created a collection. This also needs to show up if they are a part of the organization that created the collection.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-657: A user should be able to view and manage collections belonging to organisations they are a part of- 2
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[A user should be able to view and manage collections belonging to organisations they are a part of- 2](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-657)

# Summary:
- Some parts of the code have hard coded the owner of collections, concepts and mappings as the logged in user.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-662: Improve color and spacing on concept management page(edit and create concepts)
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Improve color and spacing on concept management page(edit and create concepts)](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-662)

# Summary:
Currently, this page contains multiple colors, non uniform input styling and inconsistent spacing. This ticket aims at improving the design and color on this page to improve UX.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-666: Searching or filtering on the add CIEL concepts pages should set the page back to page 1
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Searching or filtering on the add CIEL concepts pages should set the page back to page 1](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-666)

# Summary:
The current functionality fetches whatever page the user was already on. This is a problem because the user may not realize the best match to their search was on a previous page

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-683: Creating collections belonging to a user fails
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Creating collections belonging to a user fails](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-683)

# Summary:
OCLOMRS-671 makes a change that breaks this. This ticket updates the check that was previously checking for an owner called 'Individual' to check for the username instead in order to decide who the collection belongs to

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-684: Remove the initial load on the Public Dictionaries Page
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Remove the initial load on the Public Dictionaries Page](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-684)

# Summary:
This initial load is slow and following this discussion(https://talk.openmrs.org/t/developing-the-ocl-for-openmrs-application/17771/1090) and the preceding thread, the decision was to have users search before fetching any data

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-692: The collection’s default language should dictate the default language when adding a new name/ description
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[The collection’s default language should dictate the default language when adding a new name/ description](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-692)

# Summary:
Currently, this language is set to English by default. It should change based on a collection's preferred language.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLM-67: Add support for importing names of type Index Term and Short
### JIRA TICKET NAME:
[OCLM-67: Add support for importing names of type Index](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLM-67)

### Summary
When performing a concept import from the API, we convert the fully specified name types from the api into the formats used by OpenMRS. This is implemented for the fully specified name type, but not for the Index Term and Short name types.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-694: When creating a collection, the owner field says the field is required even after selecting it
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When creating a collection, the owner field says the field is required even after selecting it](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-694)

# Summary:
From OCLOMRS-133, this field should automatically select the currently logged in user as the owner if they are not part of any organizations

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-691: Set the number of levels to check for to-concepts in mappings to 10
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Set the number of levels to check for to-concepts in mappings to 10](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-691)

# Summary:
This number is arbitrary and is currently set to 2. Set this number to 10 to reduce the chance that mappings imported at the last level don't have their concepts brought in as well. Details on this are contained in ticket OCLOMRS-688.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-539: Users should be able to view concepts in a dictionary
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Users should be able to view concepts in a dictionary](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-539)

# Summary:
- Users should be able view a concept's details within the application

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-696: When you try to add a CIEL concept, even if the concept is there, it should recursively add the dependencies and give a better message
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When you try to add a CIEL concept, even if the concept is there, it should recursively add the dependencies and give a better message](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-696)

# Summary:
When you try to add a CIEL concept, even if the concept is there, it should recursively add the dependencies(this seems to already be working okay), and give a better(more informative) message(if the amount of work is justified for MVP). It currently simply says the concept was already added

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-697: App crashes when an error is encountered when creating a concept
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[App crashes when an error is encountered when creating a concept](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-697)

# Summary:
When an error occurs while creating a concept, we dispatch the errors object which gets added to the concepts list. This is incorrect and causes the app to crash

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-682: When a dictionary version is released, the download option should produce a file with mappings
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When a dictionary version is released, the download option should produce a file with mappings](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-682)

# Summary:
Mappings should be included in this file. They currently don't seem to be included

- Discussion on [talk](https://talk.openmrs.org/t/developing-the-ocl-for-openmrs-application/17771/1105)
- The download option should not be generating this file on the frontend.
- Find the endpoint that provides this file and simply link to them.
- If they are multiple/ cannot be found, drop this feature from the MVP

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-701: Add server side pagination to the dictionary concepts page
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Add server side pagination to the dictionary concepts page](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-701)

# Summary:
The dictionary concepts page currently retrieves all concepts every time it is viewed.
This presents a performance issue for the application and will make the app load slowly on poor internet connections

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-700: Viewing a concept should display the particular concept version, and not merely the latest one
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Viewing a concept should display the particular concept version, and not merely the latest one](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-700)

# Summary:
Currently, viewing a concept displays the latest version of that concept, and not the version in the collection. This is incorrect.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-702: The view dictionary page should not fetch all of a dictionary's concepts
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[The view dictionary page should not fetch all a dictionary's concepts](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-702)

# Summary:
This page currently fetches the verbose dictionary with all mappings and concepts.
This information is used to display a concept breakdown.

This presents a performance issue for this page if a dictionary contains a large number of concepts.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-704: When recursively fetching mappings while adding CIEL concepts, external mappings should be left out
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[When recursively fetching mappings while adding CIEL concepts, external mappings should be left out](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-704)

# Summary:
Currently, external mappings are included as well. This is not correct and may cause the process to fail or add incorrect concepts.

Author: Karuhanga
Text:
OCLOMRS-715: Updating a dictionary should update both the source and collection
# JIRA TICKET NAME:
[Updating a dictionary should update both the source and collection](https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/OCLOMRS-715)

# Summary:
Updating a dictionary currently only updates the collection and not the source as well. This creates a situation where the two repositories are out of sync.
